definition: to return something to its rightful owner

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Did you return the staff to rightful owner?
sentences.chinese: 你把金箍棒物归原主了么？

sentences.english: The most painful thing is money in the hand over it to its origin owner.
sentences.chinese: 最痛苦的事情就是钞票在手里过一下就物归原主啦。

sentences.english: They were later returned and are now on display.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大政府在之后物归原主，而现在得以展示。

sentences.english: To carry or send by canoe.
Tell them we were just trying to get our technology back that the stole in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 告诉他们我只是试图让我们被偷的科技物归原主。

definition: to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to lose sth and then regain it (idiom)
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner
